ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic Korean; future, present, past, instructions, questions, directions, prepositions, time, counting, etc. The usual stuff for an introductory class!

I felt as though   provided the clearest lectures Ive experienced in a Yale language classroom. My Korean has improved dramatically during this one semester, and I feel confident about continuing with the language.
Basic Korean language skills, focus on polite form. Some coverage on Korean culture through class presentations.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Professor Lim is maybe the best professor at Yale? I have been here for 2.5 years and I can't remember a more engaging/inspiring classroom environment. He teaches you so much without overworking you. He is amazing. It helped that my classmates were incredible. If you are planning on taking a language at Yale, take KREN, and take it with him.
No weaknesses.
He is very good at creating a welcoming environment where we actively participate and practice our language skills.

I love this course but I still don't know how to spell T_____T Maybe more dictation practice? Somehow I loved the focus on speaking ability though! It is fantastic to actually be able to use the language with just 3 months of learning!
Very good pace for language absorption, reasonable homework demands and great class engagement.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! great intro to korean, with or without previous experience. you'll leave with a basic reading/speaking ability.
I would recommend this class above all other classes. Its the most fun and engaging class Ive taken at Yale.

YES! Professor Lim is so great and the Korean department in general is so kind and welcoming. It was my favorite class this semester. Aside from classes, many of our classmates would go to Korean language table every week, which was a great experience for more conversational practice.
